isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - WEST COAST MAGNUM MIRRORS AND AERO MIRRORS - AERO TUBULAR SERVICE PROCEDURES

step1.para: Remove (6) screws from the face of the mirror head bezel. Remove rear shell.
On the reverse side of the mirror head assembly locate the upper c-clamp that holds the mirror head to the "C" loop. Drill out the pop rivet holding the c-clamp in position on the "C" loop.
Locate and cut the wire tie that secures the wire harness connectors to the back of the mirror head. Disconnect the connectors.
If the mirror is equipped with a CB antenna wire, separate the hex nut antenna base from the coaxial cable head and pull the head clear of the mounting bracket.
Remove (2) lock nuts each from (3) c-clamps that hold mirror head to "C" loop. Separate mirror head from "C" loop.

To install a new mirror head to the "C" loop, first locate the pop rivet hole in the "C" loop. Position a c-clamp on the "C" loop so the hole in the c-clamp aligns with the hole in the "C" loop. Fasten c-clamp to "C" loop with a pop rivet.
Position the upper mirror head mounting studs to the riveted c-clamp and install (2) lock nuts, do not tighten completely at this time.
Position the remaining c-clamps to the appropriate mounting studs, install (2) lock nuts per c-clamp. Tighten (6) lock nuts to 10 Nm (84 lbf-in).
Connect wire harness connectors. Secure wire harness to "C" loop with a wire tie.
If the mirror installation does not include a CB antenna, refer to Figure 3 and install the CB hole plug.
Position coax and CB antenna mounting hardware to the antenna bracket and secure with the hex antenna base.
Replace the mirror shell to the reverse side of the mirror head and install (6) screws through the face of the mirror head bezel.
